description: Construction of a two storey dwellinghouse as side extension (following demolition of existing two storey side extension) incorporating basement games/gym  room; and two storey rear extension and single storey front porch to existing house with associated landscape and parking.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 06B, 07B, 829/01 and 829/02A received 02/01/2014 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | A detailed method statement relating to the excavation of the basement extension shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby approved is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of site safety, the amenities of adjoining occupiers and highway safety, in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the new house shalll obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone in accordance with policies  6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and Local Variation policy 6.13 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (December 2013). | The works shall be carried out in accordance with the matching materials and finishes annotated on the approved plans unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the building and the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (December 2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E, F and G of Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no extensions, alterations or other works shall be carried out to the new house without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties, future residents of the development and the appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 7.4, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (December 2013).
